channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Sydney Airport boss Geoff Culbert says opening state borders in time for the July school holidays offers the only chance for many tourism operators to survive.
item.title: Sydney Airport urges states to open borders by July

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: A Liberal candidate is facing the sack after details of his long history of driving without a licence, driving unlicensed vehicles and defaulting on fines emerged.
item.title: Liberal candidate faces sack after revelations he drove without a licence with 30 unpaid fines

item.description: Georgia police have arrested a third person connected to the fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery, the black 25-year-old jogger whose killing in February shocked the nation.
item.title: Georgia police arrest man who filmed Ahmaud Arbery's death on murder charges

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: He is a flint-hard, expert bushman who earned his nickname from his habit of using deer antlers to make buttons and fashion large plugs for his ear piercings.
item.title: Hunt for the 'Button Man' could be key to mounting mountain mystery

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Some of its early designer collaborations were visionary in their product, if poor in their execution. But then it all fell apart.
item.title: When it came to fashion, too often Target missed the mark

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW pubs, clubs to seat up to 50 people from June as restrictions loosened; COVID-19 cases top 5.1 million worldwide, Australian death toll stands at 101

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Review finds Environment Protection Authority failed to detect or stop illegal chemical waste dumping despite repeated warnings up to two years before massive West Footscray blaze.
item.title: EPA slammed over failures to halt toxic waste dumping operation

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Eddie Blacker may be headed to the Warriors on a loan deal, with the New Zealand side desperate to fill their injury-hit roster.
item.title: 'No problem with it': Dragons open door for young gun to boost wounded Warriors

item.description: Do not expect North Queensland coach Paul Green to adopt NRL rival Brisbane's rugby-inspired rotation policy any time soon.
item.title: Cowboys not keen on NRL player rotation

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Mining and government leaders are confident that Chinese demand for high-quality Australian coal will remain strong despite the threat of import curbs.
item.title: Miners confident on China coal demand as import threat looms

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: Curtis Sittenfeld's latest novel is an alternative history about Hillary Clinton.
item.title: How Hillary dumped Bill Clinton and lived to run another day

item.description: Maya Newell's new film is available free for schools during Reconciliation Week, May 27 until June 3.
item.title: On my mind: film director Maya Newell

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police have closed all westbound lanes on the Logan Motorway as they work to clear the scene on Friday afternoon.
item.title: Logan Motorway closed after truck hits barrier, spills load across lanes

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Clive Palmer said the closures breached Section 92 of the Constitution which states trade, commerce, and intercourse among the states shall be absolutely free.
item.title: Clive Palmer to challenge WA border closures in High Court after exemption application denied

item.dc:creator: Caroline Wilson
item.description: AFL coaches have taken significant pay cuts, but for those on long-term deals, what happens beyond 2020 in a markedly changed environment?
item.title: Long-term coaching deals a heavy burden for AFL clubs

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: Scott Pendlebury has called for a drastic overhaul of the AFL calendar which would see the pre-season cut by 60 per cent and the season greatly lengthened.
item.title: Pendlebury wants longer season, wildcard weekend

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: In the TAB Victory Stakes, a lead-up race to next month's Stradbroke Handicap, Kementari is searching for his first win since returning to racing as a gelding.
item.title: Kementari aiming to break two-year drought

item.description: Indian authorities on Friday began assessing damage and clearing roads in the wake of Cyclone Amphan, which killed at least 95 people and displaced millions.
item.title: Recovery begins in the wake of Cyclone Amphan

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Twelve new cases in Victoria; Minister outlines VCE plan, no blanket special consideration; Australia's death toll rises to 101

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Broadcast consultants Shane Mattiske and Michael Tange have been moved on from RA despite the organisation having yet to secure a new television rights deal.
item.title: Rugby Australia releases two broadcast consultants despite no TV deal

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Just one week after venues were opened to 10 people, Premier Gladys Berejiklian said the next move was an "important, critical, big step".
item.title: Saving jobs the motivation to allow more patrons into pubs, cafes and restaurants

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: She's one of Australia's best-known actors, an advocate for her profession and an artist who paints on toast.
item.title: Toast of the town: the shimmering talent of Heather Mitchell

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Fitch puts Australia's triple A credit rating on negative outlook as new figures point to a budget deficit of up to $75 billion.
item.title: Agency puts Australia on notice amid concerns about household debt

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: School principals have led their communities through fire, flood and plague this year. And it's not yet June.
item.title: Fire, flood, plague, and the little school that's weathered them all

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes' new series Belgravia is darkly ambitious, setting the stage for a clash of cultural power.
item.title: From book to blockbuster, Belgravia is the Imperial Leather of TV soap

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: How did bookshops survive the dismal days of closed doors?
item.title: Bookmarks: How the customer remains the crucial element

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: An audaciously bleak Western, a philosophical horror movie, a cartoonish thriller â€” and a couple of films that fit no known mold.
item.title: Top five films: what's new in streaming

item.dc:creator: Barry Divola
item.description: For those wondering how this period in time will be remembered, Britain's prevailing pop futurist Charli XCX has the answer.
item.title: Charli XCX's isolation album is both a time capsule and a chance to escape

item.description: Humour emerges in times of anxiety. But what to call that barista's inventive doover lackey across the Tasman?
item.title: Lockdown draws out Kiwi ingenuity: Sweet-az-brew

item.description: Great art might look easy, but the evidence proves otherwise.
item.title: Put the camera down, R-Patz: you're no better than my 10-year-old

item.dc:creator: Thomas Keneally
item.description: Amid all manner of virtual offerings, our need to gather is under siege.
item.title: Can the physical world compete in the time of COVID-19?

item.dc:creator: Barry Divola
item.description: Interviewing Dolly Parton for a new podcast, Radiolab creator Jad Abumrad found that a country superstar said a whole lot about an entire country.
item.title: The radical side of the one-and-only Dolly Parton

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: Confined characters know just how we feel right now.
item.title: Madness and mystery: why lockdown is the stuff of cinematic dreams

item.description: Revisiting the literary legend reminds us of who we are, says musician John Schumann.
item.title: Do we still have time for Henry Lawson?

item.description: Emily St John Mandel's latest novel bounces off the disgraced Bernie Madoff's Ponzi scheme
item.title: Mandel catches a feel of the zeitgeist again in her fiction

item.description: From the gardens of colonial settlers to the suburbs of the north shore, the winter favourite continues to evolve.
item.title: Champions of the camellia: Sydney's love affair continues

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: Even the most dissolute Bohemian artists achieved immortality through time spent alone solving aesthetic problems.
item.title: Is joy in solitude a catalyst for artistic expression?

item.description: Catherine Bond's book examines the impact of legislative changes and judicial outcomes on people during World War I.
item.title: How the government used the law to clamp down in World War I

item.description: Charles Dickens didn't hold out much hope for his son Plorn, whom he packed off to Australia at the age of 15.
item.title: Adrift in Australia, Charles Dickens' youngest son finds a new story

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: Health journalist Shannon Harvey was in "a prettty dark place" when she decided to meditate every day for a year for her new documentary,
item.title: Filmmaker's year-long experiment to learn if science can prove meditation works

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Jennifer Cook, who arrived from California on Monday to be with her dying sister, has spent most of her time alone in a hotel room in strict quarantine.
item.title: 'I just want her close': Dying woman asks to be with quarantined sister

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Ms Dillon sought expenses including a $2.5 million home in Sydney's east and money for dental implants and a kitchen.
item.title: Bob Hawke's daughter Rosslyn Dillon settles $4.2 million challenge to his will

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: This maths error is probably the biggest mistake of its kind in Australian political history. It could be the biggest opportunity as well.
item.title: This is a costings blunder made in political heaven

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Victorian shoppers mourn Target, which will close or convert 167 of its stores.
item.title: 'Gradually gone downhill': Target shoppers mourn end of 'institution'

item.description: The restaurant has been convicted after failing to store food safely, keep the premises and equipment clean, and keep equipment in good repair.
item.title: Barrack Street sushi restaurant fined for poor hygiene

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Deputy Nationals leader David Littleproud has called for a boycott of struggling department store chain Target after parent company Wesfarmers said it would shut regional locations.
item.title: 'They don't give a rats': Minister calls for Target boycott after 75 stores axed

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: There have been 27 cases of COVID-19 so far according to NSW Health in the Blue Mountains region that normally attracts 4 million visitors annually.
item.title: 'Not convinced it's safe': Blue Mountains mayor unsure about reopening

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Beijing is set to establish new national security agencies and introduce a raft of tough new laws against dissent in Hong Kong as it attempts to wipe out protests in the Chinese territory.
item.title: 'Prevent, stop and punish': China's new Hong Kong sedition laws spark backlash

item.dc:creator: Max Presnell
item.description: Chris Waller's gun three-year-old has attracted big-money bids from China's racing mecca and can show why at Eagle Farm on Saturday.
item.title: Citizen Kinane can show Hong Kong admirers what they're missing

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: The Herald's state political correspondent Alexandra Smith and national editor Tory Maguire discuss the conflict between Australia's state premiers over border closures.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: the border wars
